topic.title: TRSDOS-II System Errors Table
topic.shortdesc: List of the possible TRSDOS-II error messages you may encounter when using the TRS-80.

stentry.p: Code
Message
Explanation/Action
No Error Found.
No error occurred.
Bad Function Code On SVC Call Or No Function Exists.
Check the function code number used on the SVC call.
Character Not Available.
No record or character was available when you you called the SVC.
Parameter Error On Call.
Parameter is incorrect or a required parameter is missing.
CRC Error During Disk I/O.
Try the operation again, using a different diskette. If the problem occurs often, contact RSSC.
Disk Sector Not Found.
Try a different diskette.
Attempt To Open A File Which Has Not Been Closed.
Close the file before re-opening.
Illegal Disk Change. Disk Drive Not Ready.
TRSDOS-II detected an illegal disk swap.
Disk Drive Not Ready.
Drive door is open or the diskette is not in the drive. On Thinline drives, check the DRIVE command settings.
Invalid Data Provided By Caller.
Data stream to be processed has illegal characters.
Maximum Of 16 Files May Be Open At Once.
Too many files are open at once.
File Already In Directory.
Filename already exists as a directory entry. Kill the existing file, choose another filename, or specify a drive number.
No Drive Available For An Open.
No on-line drive

li.p: has enough space to create a new file, or

stentry.p: Write Attempt To A Read Only File.
File was opened for read only, not for read/write.
Write Fault On Disk I/O.
Error occurred during a write operation. Try a different diskette. If the problem continues, contact RSSC.
Disk Is Write Protected.
Write enable the disk.
DCB Is Modified And Is Unusable.
DCB (used in machine-language programming) has been modified since the last disk access (while the file was open).
Directory Read Error.
Error occurred during an attempt to read the directory. Use a different diskette.
Directory Write Error.
Error occurred during an attempt to write to the directory. Use a different diskette.
Improper File Name (Filespec).
Filespec you gave does not meet TRSDOS-II standard file specifications.
Unknown Error Code
Unknown Error Code
Unknown Error Code
Unknown Error Code
File Not Found.
Filename you gave was not found on the available disks or the file is the incorrect type for the desired operation.
File Access Denied Due To Password Protection.
You gave an incorrect password. See the ATTRIB command.
Directory Space Full.
Number of filenames has reached the amount set when you formatted the disk.
Disk Space Full.
No space is available on the disk.
Attempt To Read Past EOF.
Specified record number is past the EOF.
Read Attempt Outside Of File Limits.
Use valid record numbers.
No More Extents Available (16 Maximum).
Use the COPY command to copy the files and reduce fragmentation. See also SAVE/RESTORE and MOVE.
Program Not Found.
Specified program is not found on the available disks.
Unknown Drive Number (Filespec).
Specified drive number is not valid.
Disk Space Allocation Cannot Be Made Due To Fragmentation Of Space.
Use the COPY command to copy the files and reduce fragmentation.
Attempt To Use A NON Program File As A Program.
File specified for execution is not a program file or the load address given is illegal. Make sure you have a system diskette in Drive 0.
Memory Fault During Program Load.
Program is loaded incorrectly, possibly because of faulty memory or a "bad" load address.
Parameter For Open Is Incorrect.
Check the OPEN statements or the DCB for errors.
Open Attempt For A File Already Open.
File specified for open is already open.
I/O Attempt To An Unopen File.
Open the file before access.
Illegal I/O Attempt.

li.p: I command not given after a diskette swap.
Can be caused by an I/O attempt to a differently formatted disk. Format the disk under the current version of TRSDOS-II or use FCOPY.

stentry.p: Seek Error.

li.p: Data cannot be read from the disk – faulty disk.
When re-initializing a hard disk, you must also reformat the secondary drives.

stentry.p: Data Lost During Disk I/O (Hardware Fault).
Contact RSSC.
Printer Not Ready.
Check the connections, power, ribbon, on-line status, and so on.
Printer Out Of Paper.
Check the printer’s paper supply.
Printer Fault (May Be Turned Off).
Check the connections, power, ribbon, on-line status, and so on.
Printer Not Available.
Check the connections, power, ribbon, on-line status, and so on.
Not Applicable To VLR Type Files.
Operation performed is not valid for VLR files.
Required Command Parameter Not Found.
Required parameter or argument is missing from the command.
Incorrect Command Parameter.
Option or argument given in the command is incorrect.
Hardware Fault During Disk I/O.
Contact RSSC.
Invalid Space Descriptor.
The space descriptor that tells TRSDOS-II which extent to read next is invalid. Try a different diskette.
Unknown error code

body.p: These codes are also returned to machine code routines that call a SVC (System Service Call) of TRSDOS-II. Register A usually has a return code after any function call. The Z flag is set when no error occurs. Exceptions are certain computational routines, which use Registers A and F to pass back data and status information.
